news.title: Man who stabbed ex-partner Sarah McNally to death in New York bar jailed for 24 years
news.summary: The former boyfriend of an Irishwoman who was stabbed to death in a New York bar last year has been sentenced to 24 years in prison.

news.title: Denis O'Brien and spokesman James Morrissey must pay two solicitors €411,750 each in one of biggest defamation payouts ever
news.summary: Denis O’Brien defamed two lawyers in a 2016 press release that implied they acted for the IRA, a High Court jury has found.

news.title: Two funerals of ‘lifelong friends’ killed in Co Louth crash which claimed five lives take place
news.summary: The first two funerals of five young people who lost their lives in an horrific crash in Co Louth have taken place today.

news.title: Gardaí believe Enoch Burke is hiding in family home – days after order by High Court returning him to prison for contempt
news.summary: Enoch Burke remained at liberty last night despite multiple attempts by gardaí to execute an order by the High Court returning him to prison for contempt.

news.title: ‘The joy in her eyes chips away at any ache the heart carries’ – Parents of girl stabbed in Parnell Square issue update
news.summary: The family of the young girl who was severely injured in a mass stabbing outside her school on Parnell Square in Dublin have said they will close their GoFundMe page as it approaches the two-year anniversary of the attack.

news.title: Woman (70s) killed in Louth collision hours before funeral of road crash victim Dylan Commins in same town
news.summary: A woman in her 70s has died following a crash involving a number of vehicles in Ardee, Co Louth, this morning.

news.title: Rúaidhrí O’Connor: From disco lights to hybrid players, how ‘completely mental’ Rassie Erasmus stays ahead of the game
news.summary: Rassie Erasmus was involved in more than 16 businesses. He co-owned a petrol station, ran a security company, got involved in cattle farming and grew a herd of eight cattle to 64. He started a company called Edge Sport, which filmed rugby matches that had no TV coverage.

news.title: ‘If we wanted to price gouge, we would add one or two flights, we added 15’ – Michael O’Leary defends €700 Prague fares for Ireland play-off
news.summary: Michael O’Leary has defended the price of Ryanair flights from Ireland to Prague for next March’s World Cup play-off against Czechia.

news.title: Explainer: The radical changes to Eurovision voting rules and what it means for Ireland
news.summary: The organiser of the Eurovision Song Contest, the European Broadcasting Union (EBU), has announced radical changes in the voting rules for the singing spectacle.

news.title: ‘I just wanted to not get fired in the first six months’ – Tracy Clifford on a decade at RTÉ 2FM
news.summary: For someone whose plan was “not to get sacked in the first six months”, 2FM’s Tracy Clifford has certainly exceeded her own expectations.
